sentences.text: What Is New In This Year's Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refined the Shareholder Value Award (SVA), one of the equity compensation programs for our executive officers, to include a Total Shareholder Return (TSR) modifier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares to be awarded under the SVA will increase or decrease by 1 percent for every percentage point that Lilly's three-year TSR deviates from our peer group's median three- year TSR (capped at +/-20 percent).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change rewards our executive officers for delivering top performance within the industry and increasing shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers received a larger portion of their total equity as SVAs (from 50 percent to 60 percent) to incentivize behavior that is aligned with long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, John C. Lechleiter, Ph.D., retired as President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David A. Ricks became President and CEO, and a member of the Board of Directors, on January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Lechleiter will serve as non-executive chairman until May 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On June 1, 2017, Mr. Ricks will succeed him as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, we welcomed Jamere Jackson to the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jackson is CFO of Nielsen Holdings plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, we welcomed Carolyn R. Bertozzi, Ph.D., to the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Bertozzi is the Anne T. and Robert M. Bass Professor of Chemistry and Professor of Chemical and Systems Biology and Radiology at Stanford University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She is an investigator for the Howard Hughes Medical Institute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the board approved an annual compensation cap of $800,000 for non-employee directors, which is reflected in the provisions of the amended Directors' Deferral Plan (see Item 5).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following provides a brief look at our 2016 performance in three dimensions: operating performance, innovation progress, and shareholder return.

sentences.text: 2016 revenue increased 6 percent to approximately $21.2 billion.

sentences.text: Innovation Progress
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made significant advances with our pipeline in 2016, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. approval of a new cardiovascular (CV) indication for Jardiance (empagliflozin) tablets and an EU label update to include a change to the indication statement regarding the reduction of  risk of CV death in adults with type 2 diabetes and established CV disease.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. approval and conditional EU approval for LartruvoTM (olaratumab) for soft tissue sarcoma.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S., EU, and Japan approval for Taltz (ixekizumab) for moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple new indications in the EU and Japan for Cyramza
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Return
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generated strong TSR (share price appreciation plus dividends, reinvested quarterly) for the three- and five-year periods through year-end 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our returns exceeded both the compensation peer group and the S&P 500 in the three- and five-year periods, but lagged for the one-year period that ended on December 31, 2016:

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Programs Reflect Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a blend of short- and long-term performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee annually reviews compensation programs to ensure they provide incentives to deliver long-term, sustainable business results while discouraging excessive risk-taking or other adverse behaviors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a broad compensation recovery policy that applies to all executives and covers a wide range of misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers (EOs) are subject to robust stock ownership guidelines and are prohibited from hedging or pledging their company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our severance plans related to change-in-control generally require a double trigge
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Summary for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the total target compensation was established at the end of 2015, compensation for our named executive officers (the five officers whose compensation is disclosed in this proxy statement) was in the middle range of the company's peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive compensation programs paid out above target, consistent with the company's strong performance in 2016, as outlined below under "Pay for Performance."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in the Compensation Disclosures and Analysis (CD&A) section, we link our incentive pay programs to a balanced mix of measures on three dimensions of company performance: operating performance; progress
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: with our innovation pipeline; and shareholder return.

sentences.text: We exceeded our EPS growth targets under our Performance Award program, which has targets based on expected EPS growth of peer companies over a two-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This performance resulted in a Performance Award multiple in excess of the target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Shareholder Value Award Multiple
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We significantly exceeded our stock price growth targets under our Shareholder Value Award program, which has targets based on expected large-cap company returns over a three-year period.

sentences.text: This performance resulted in a Shareholder Value Award multiple in excess of the target.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in 2016 and 2017, three members retired or will retire from the board: Ms. Karen Horn, Dr. John Lechleiter, and Dr. Frank Prendergast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the following chart demonstrates, our director composition also reflects a mix of tenure on the board, which provides an effective balance of historical perspective and an understanding of the evolution of our business with fresh perspectives and insights.

sentences.text: Diversity: The board strives to achieve diversity in the broadest sense, including persons diverse in geography, gender, ethnicity, and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the board does not establish specific diversity goals or have a stand-alone diversity policy, the board's overall diversity is an important consideration in the director selection and nomination process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee assesses the effectiveness of board diversity efforts in connection with the annual nomination process as well as in new director searches.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company's sixteen directors range in age from 45 to 72, and include four women and five ethnically diverse members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Character: Board members should possess the personal attributes necessary to be an effective director, including unquestioned integrity, sound judgment, a collaborative spirit, and commitment to the company, our shareholders, and other constituencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board delegates the director screening process to the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee, which receives input from other board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential directors are identified from several sources, including executive search firms retained by the committee, incumbent directors, management, and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee employs the same process for evaluating all candidates, including those submitted by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee initially evaluates a candidate based on publicly available information and any additional information supplied by the party recommending the candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the candidate appears to satisfy the selection criteria and the committees initial evaluation is favorable, the committee, assisted by management or a search firm, gathers additional data on the candidates qualifications, availability, probable level of interest, and any potential conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the committees subsequent evaluation continues to be favorable, the candidate is contacted by the Chairman of the Board and one or more of the independent directors, including the lead director, for direct discussions to determine the mutual level of interest in pursuing the candidacy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If these discussions are favorable, the committee makes a final recommendation to the board to nominate the candidate for election by the shareholders (or to select the candidate to fill a vacancy, as applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee performs periodic assessments of the overall composition and skills of the board in order to ensure that the board and management are actively engaged in succession planning for directors, and that our board reflects the appropriate viewpoints, diversity, and expertise necessary to support our complex and evolving business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee, with input from all board members, also considers the contributions of the individual directors at least every three years when considering whether to nominate the director to a new three-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of these assessments inform the board's recommendations on nominations for directors at the annual meeting each year and help provide us with insight on the types of experiences, skills, and other characteristics we should be seeking for future director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this assessment, the committee has recommended that the directors in the 2017 class be elected at the 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director compensation is reviewed and approved annually by the board, on the recommendation of the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee.

sentences.text: Stock Compensation Directors are required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are required to hold meaningful equity ownership positions in the company; accordingly, a significant portion of director compensation is in the form of deferred Lilly stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are required to hold Lilly stock, directly or through company plans, valued at not less than five times their annual board retainer; new directors are allowed five years to reach his ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors serving at least five years have satisfied these guidelines, and all other directors are making progress toward these requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors received $160,000 of compensation (but no more than 7,500 shares), deposited annually in a deferred stock account in the Lilly Directors Deferral Plan (as described below), payable beginning the second January following the director's departure from board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lilly Directors Deferral Plan: In addition to stock compensation, the Lilly Directors' Deferral Plan allows non-employee directors to defer receipt of all or part of their cash compensation until after their service on the board has ended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director can choose to invest the amounts deferred in one or both of the following two accounts:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Stock Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This account allows the director, in effect, to invest his or her deferred cash compensation in company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Funds in this account are credited as hypothetical shares of company stock based on the closing stock price on pre-set monthly dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the annual stock compensation award as described above is also credited to this account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares credited is calculated by dividing the $160,000 annual compensation figure by the closing stock price on a pre-set annual date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hypothetical dividends are reinvested in additional shares based on the market price of the stock on the date dividends are paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual shares are issued on the second January following the director's departure from board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Funds in this account earn interest each year at a rate of 120 percent of the applicable federal long-term rate, compounded monthly, as established the preceding December by the U.S. Treasury Department under Section 1274(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Internal Revenue Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of interest that accrued in 2016 for the participating directors was $124,379, at a rate of 3.1 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rate for 2017 is 2.7 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both accounts may generally only be paid in a lump sum or in annual installments for up to 10 years, beginning the second January following the directors departure from board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts in the deferred stock account are paid in shares of company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Item 5, Amendment of the Lilly Directors' Deferral Plan, for more information regarding this plan.

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board annually determines the independence of directors based on a review by the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director is considered independent unless the board has determined that he or she has no material relationship with the company, either directly or as a partner, significant shareholder, or officer of an organization that has a material relationship with the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material relationships can include commercial, industrial, banking, consulting, legal, accounting, charitable, and familial relationships, among others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To evaluate the materiality of any such relationship, the board has adopted categorical independence standards consistent with the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) listing standards, except that the look-back period for determining whether a directors prior relationship(s) with the company impairs independence is extended from three to four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company's process for determining director independence is set forth in our Standards for Director Independence, which can be found on our website at https://www.lilly.com/who-we-are/governance, along with our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the recommendation of the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee, the board determined that each current non-employee director, other than Dr. Lechleiter, is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to expiration of her board term in 2016, the board reached the same conclusion regarding Ms. Horn, and determined that the members of each committee also meet our independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any of the relationships referenced above or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Compliance and Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board, together with the Audit and Public Policy and Compliance Committees, oversees the processes by which the company conducts its business to ensure the company operates in a manner that complies with laws and regulations and reflects the highest standards of integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company also has an enterprise risk management program overseen by its chief ethics and compliance officer, who reports directly to the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enterprise risks are identified and prioritized by management through both top-down and bottom-up processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The top priorities are assigned to a board committee or full board for oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company management is charged with managing risk through robust internal processes and controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The enterprise risk management program as a whole is reviewed annually at a full board meeting, and enterprise risks are also addressed in periodic business function reviews and at the annual board and senior management strategy session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board approves the company's code of ethics, which is set out in:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Red Book: a comprehensive code of ethical and legal business conduct applicable to all employees worldwide and to our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Red Book is reviewed and approved annually by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethical Conduct for Lilly Financial Management: a supplemental code for our CEO and all members of financial management, in recognition of their unique responsibilities to ensure proper accounting, financial reporting, internal controls, and financial stewardship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These documents are available online at: https://www.lilly.com/who-we-are/governance/ethics-and-compliance-program and https://www.lilly.com/ethical-conduct-for-financial-management, or upon request to the company's corporate secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of any amendments to, or waivers from, a provision of the code affecting the chief executive officer, chief financial officer, chief accounting officer, controller, or persons performing similar functions, we intend to post on the above website within four business days after the event a description of the amendment or waiver as required under applicable Securities and Exchange Commission rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will maintain that information on our website for at least 12 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of the Companys Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is committed to good corporate governance, which promotes the long-term interests of shareholders and other company stakeholders, builds confidence in our company leadership, and strengthens accountability for the board and company management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has adopted corporate governance guidelines that set forth the company's basic principles of corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The section that follows outlines key elements of the guidelines and other governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investors can learn more by reviewing the corporate governance guidelines, which are available online at https://www.lilly.com/who-we-are/governance or upon request to the companys corporate secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors are elected by the shareholders to oversee the actions and results of the companys management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board exercises oversight over a broad range of areas, but the board's key responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing general oversight of the business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approving major management initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: selecting, compensating, evaluating, and, when necessary, replacing the chief executive officer, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensating other senior executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensuring that an effective succession plan is in place for all executive officers and reviewing the broader talent management process, including diversity and inclusion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: overseeing the companys ethics and compliance program and management of significant business risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: overseeing the company's enterprise risk management progra
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Composition and Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mix of Independent Directors and Officer-Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There should always be a substantial majority (75 percent or more) of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO should be a board member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an uncontested election, directors are elected by a majority of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An incumbent nominee who fails to receive a majority of the votes cast will tender his or her resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board, on recommendation of the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee, will decide whether to accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company will promptly disclose the board's decision, including, if applicable, the reasons why the board rejected the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Tenure and Retirement Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors must retire no later than the date of the annual meeting that follows their seventy-second birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee has authority to recommend exceptions to this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee, with input from all board members, also considers the contributions of the individual directors at least every three years when considering whether to nominate the director to a new three-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Board Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, no director may serve on more than three other public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee may approve exceptions if it determines that the additional service will not impair the director's effectiveness on the Lilly board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee reviewed an exception request for Mr. Alvarez (who serves on four other company boards), considering his attendance record and continued engagement in board matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon review, the committee determined that he could effectively balance his other board responsibilities and continue to be a strong contributor to the Lilly board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Confidentiality Policy The board has adopted a Confidentiality Policy, applicable to all current and future members of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy prohibits a director from sharing confidential information obtained in his or her role as a director with any outside party except under limited circumstances where the director is seeking legal advice or is required to disclose information by order of law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Confidentiality Policy can be viewed on the company's website here: http://www.lilly.com/about/corporate-governance/Pages/corporate-governance.aspx.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure; Oversight of Chairman, CEO, and Senior Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board currently believes that combining the role of Chairman of the Board and the CEO, coupled with a strong lead director position, is the most efficient and effective leadership model for the company, fostering clear accountability, effective decision-making, and alignment on corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board periodically reviews its leadership structure and developments in the area of corporate governance in order to ensure that this approach continues to strike the appropriate balance for the company and our stakeholders, most recently
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: during the succession-management process relating to the retirement of Dr. Lechleiter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has put in place a number of governance practices to ensure effective independent oversight, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive sessions of the independent directors: held after every regular board meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual performance evaluation of the chairman and CEO: conducted by the independent directors, the results of which are reviewed with the CEO and considered by the Compensation Committee in establishing the CEOs compensation for the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A strong, independent, clearly defined lead director role: The lead director's responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: leading the boards processes for selecting and evaluating the CEO;  presiding at all meetings of the board at which the chairman is not prese
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if requested by major shareholders, ensures that she is available for consultation and direct communication;  approving meeting agendas and schedules and generally approving information sent to the board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: conducting executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director also has authority to call meetings of the independent directors and to retain advisers for the ndependent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director is appointed annually by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently Ms. Marram is the lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director access to management and independent advisors: Independent directors have direct access to members of management whenever they deem it necessary, and the company's EOs attend part of each regula scheduled board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors and all committees are also free to retain their own independent advisors, at company expense, whenever they feel it would be desirable to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, board, and CEO annually review the company's succession plans for the CEO and other key senior leadership positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors also meet without the CEO to discuss CEO succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During these reviews, the CEO and directors discuss:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: future candidates for the CEO and other senior leadership positions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: succession timing; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: development plans for the highest-potential candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company ensures that the directors have multiple opportunities to interact with the company's top leadership talent in both formal and informal settings in order to allow them to most effectively assess the candidates' qualifications and capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the board followed this process, and the independent directors also met without the CEO present when selecting Mr. Ricks to succeed Dr. Lechleiter as president and CEO of the company, effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors and the CEO maintain a confidential plan for the timely and efficient transfer of the CEO's responsibilities in the event of an emergency or his sudden departure, incapacitation, or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Education and Annual Performance Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company engages in a comprehensive orientation process for incoming new directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors also receive ongoing continuing educational sessions on areas of particular relevance or importance to our company, and we hold periodic mandatory training sessions for the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee conducts an annual assessment of the board's performance, board committee performance, and all board processes based on input from all directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conflicts of Interest and Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conflicts of Interest
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors must disclose to the company all relationships that create a conflict or an appearance of a conflict.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board, after consultation with counsel, takes appropriate steps to identify actual or apparent conflicts and ensure that all directors voting on an issue are disinterested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director may be excused from discussions on the issue, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and Approval of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has adopted a policy and procedures for review, approval, and monitoring of transactions involving the company and related persons (directors and EOs, their immediate family members, or shareholders of more than 5 percent of the companys outstanding stock).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy covers any related-person transaction that meets the minimum hreshold for disclosure in the proxy statement under the relevant SEC rules (generally, transactions involving amounts exceeding $120,000 in which a related person has a direct or indirect material interest).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy: Related-person transactions must be approved by the board or by a committee of the board consisting solely of independent directors, who will approve the transaction only if they determine that it is in the best interests of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering the transaction, the board or committee will consider all relevant factors, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the companys business rationale for entering into the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the alternatives to entering into a related-person transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction is on terms comparable to those available to third parties, or in the case of employment relationships, to employees generally;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the potential for the transaction to lead to an actual or apparent conflict of interest and any safeguards imposed to prevent such actual or apparent conflicts; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Procedures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management or the affected director or EO will bring the matter to the attention of the chairman, the lead director, the chair of the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee, or the corporate secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chairman and the lead director shall jointly determine (or, if either is involved in the transaction, the other shall determine) whether the matter should be considered by the board or by one of its existing committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The transaction must be approved in advance whenever practicable, and if not practicable, must be ratified, if appropriate, as promptly as practicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee has approved the following employment relationships that are considered related-party transactions under the SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have three current employees who are relatives of current or former EOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. John Bamforth, vice president, chief marketing officer, global marketing, is the spouse of Dr. Susan Mahony, an EO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Myles ONeill, senior vice president, global drug products, is the spouse of Dr. Fionnuala Walsh, an EO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, Andrew Lechleiter, general manager, Hong Kong, is the son of Dr. John Lechleiter, Lilly's former CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, these three employees received cash compensation, and equity grants between $195,000 and $1,480,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All three individuals participate in the companys benefit programs generally available to U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Their compensation is consistent with the compensation paid to other employees at their levels and with the Company's overall compensation principles based on their years of experience, performance, and positions within the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may send written communications to one or more members of the board, addressed to: Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement on Governance Issues
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the company engages large shareholders and other key constituents to discuss key areas of interest or concern related to corporate governance, as well as any specific issues for the coming proxy season.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we spoke with a number of our largest investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Issues discussed included shareholders' perspectives regarding a potential management proposal to eliminate the company's classified board and supermajority voting requirements, proxy access, board composition and recruitment, and the company's executive compensation, among other topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall tone from these conversations was positive and the investors with whom we spoke were generally supportive of our overall compensation and governance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have shared the feedback we received from these conversations with our Compensation Committee and Directors and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to continuing to engage with our investors to ensure their diverse perspectives are thoughtfully considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior Management Proposals to Eliminate Classified Board and Supermajority Voting Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between 2007 and 2012, each year we submitted management proposals to eliminate the company's classified board structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposals did not pass because they failed to receive a supermajority vote of 80 percent of the outstanding shares, as required in the company's articles of incorporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2010, 2011, 2012, we submitted management proposals to eliminate the supermajority voting requirements themselves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those proposals also fell short of he required 80 percent vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2012, these proposals received support ranging from 72 to 77 percent of the outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, the vote was even lower, approximately 63 percent of the outstanding shares, driven in part by a 2012 NYSE rule revision prohibiting brokers from voting their clients' shares on corporate governance matters absent specific instructions from such clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have decided not to resubmit those proposals in 2016 based on our discussions with large shareholders as described above and our assessment that the proposals would not be successful.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to monitor this situation and engage with our shareholders on these and other topics to ensure that we continue to demonstrate strong corporate governance and accountability to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder wishes to have a proposal considered for inclusion in next years proxy statement, he or she must submit the proposal in writing so that we receive it by November 20, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals should be addressed to the companys corporate secretary, Lilly Corporate Center, Indianapolis, Indiana 46285.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the companys bylaws provide that any shareholder wishing to propose any other business at the annual meeting must give the company written notice by November 20, 2017, and no earlier than September 21, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That notice must provide certain other information as described in the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the bylaws are available online at https://www.lilly.com/who-we-are/governance or upon request to the companys corporate secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Recommendations and Nominations for Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder who wishes to recommend a director candidate for evaluation should forward the candidate's name and information about the candidate's qualifications to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chair of the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee c/o Corporate Secretary Lilly Corporate Center Indianapolis, IN 46285
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidate must meet the selection criteria described above and must be willing and expressly interested in serving on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 1.9 of the companys bylaws, a shareholder who wishes to directly nominate a director candidate at the 2018 annual meeting (i.e., to propose a candidate for election who is not otherwise nominated by the board through the recommendation process described above) must give the company written notice by November 20, 2017, and no earlier than September 21, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice should be addressed to the corporate secretary at the address provided above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice must contain prescribed information about the candidate and about the shareholder proposing the candidate as described in more detail in Section 1.9 of the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the bylaws is available online at https://www.lilly.com/who- we-are/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bylaws will also be provided by mail upon request to the corporate secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not received any notice regarding shareholder nominations for board candidates or other shareholder business to be presented at the meeting.

sentences.text: Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Compensation Paid to Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 provides the company's shareholders with the opportunity to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the company's named executive officers as disclosed in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy is designed to attract and retain highly talented individuals and motivate them to create ong-term shareholder value by achieving top-tier corporate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance while embracing the companys values of integrity, excellence, and respect for people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors believe that our executive compensation aligns well with our philosophy and with corporate performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive compensation is an important matter for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We routinely review our compensation practices and engage in ongoing dialog with our shareholders in order to ensure our practices are aligned with stakeholder interests and reflect best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We request shareholder approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of the companys named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee values input from shareholders and will consider the outcome of the vote when making future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Recommendation on Item 2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation paid to the named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the CD&A, the compensation tables, and related narratives provided below in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A describes our executive compensation philosophy, the Compensation Committee's process for setting executive compensation, the elements of our compensation program, the factors the committee considered when setting executive compensation in 2016, and how the company's results affected incentive payouts for 2016 performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say-on-Pay Results for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At last year's annual meeting, more than 98 percent of the shares cast voted in favor of the company's Say-on-Pay proposal on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management and the Compensation Committee view this vote as supportive of the company's overall approach toward executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Philosophy on Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Lilly, our mission is to make medicines that help people live longer, healthier, more active lives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to accomplish our mission, we must attract, engage, and retain highly talented individuals who are committed to the company's core values of integrity, excellence, and respect for people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are designed to help us achieve these goals while balancing the long-term interests of our shareholders and customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation and benefits programs are based on the following objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflect individual and company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reinforce a high-performance culture by linking pay with individual performance and company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As employees assume greater responsibilities, the proportion of total compensation based on company performance and shareholder returns increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We perform an annual review to ensure the programs provide incentives to deliver long-term, sustainable business results while discouraging excessive risk-taking or other adverse behaviors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain talented employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation opportunities should be competitive with our peer group and reflect the level of job impact and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of talent is an important factor in the design of our compensation and benefit programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implement broad-based programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the amount of compensation paid to employees varies, the overall structure of our compensation and benefit programs is broadly similar across the organization to encourage and reward all employees who contribute to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider shareholder input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management and the Compensation Committee consider the results of our annual Say-on-Pay vote and other sources of shareholder feedback when designing compensation and benefit programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee's Processes and Analyses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Process for setting compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the following in determining executive compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO: Generally, the independent directors, under the direction of the lead director, meet with the CEO at the beginning of each year to agree upon the CEO's performance objectives for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the year, the independent directors meet to assess the CEO's achievement of those objectives along with other factors, including contribution to the company's performance and ethics and integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The year-end evaluation is used in setting the CEO's compensation for the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, David A. Ricks was appointed to serve as CEO, effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His compensation for the role of President and CEO was set at the time of his appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Executive Officers (EOs): The committee receives individual performance assessments and compensation recommendations from the CEO and exercises its judgment based on the board's knowledge and interactions with the EOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each EO's performance assessment is based on achievement of objectives established between such EO and the CEO at the start of the year, as well as other factors, including the demonstration of Lilly values and leadership behaviors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For new EOs, compensation is set at time of promotion or offer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assessment of company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers company performance in two ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a factor in establishing potential compensation for the coming year, the committee considers overall company performance during the prior year across a variety of metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To determine payouts under the cash and equity incentive programs, the committee establishes specific company performance goals related to revenue, earnings per share (EPS), progress of our pipeline portfolio, stock price growth, and Total Shareholder Return (TSR) relative to our peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer-group analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee uses peer-group data as a market check for compensation decisions, but does not use this data as the sole basis for its compensation targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does not target a specific position within that range of market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Input from an independent compensation consultant concerning executive pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role of the independent compensation consultant is described in more detail under the "Compensation Committee Matters" section that follows the CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive pay assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our peer group is comprised of companies that directly compete with us, operate in a similar business model, and employ people with the unique skills required to operate an established biopharmaceutical company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee selects a peer group whose median market cap and revenues are broadly similar to Lilly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee reviews the peer group at east every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee reviewed the peer group in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee removed Allergan (acquired by Actavis Plc) and replaced Abbott with Shire Plc, lowering the peer group median revenues and market cap.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer group referenced in December 2015 when assessing competitive pay included: Abbvie, Amgen, AstraZeneca, Baxter, Biogen, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Celgene, Gilead, GlaxoSmithKline, Hoffman-La Roche, Johnson & Johnson, Medtronic, Merck, Novartis,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pfizer, Sanofi-Aventis, and Shire Plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of Johnson & Johnson, Novartis, and Pfizer, peer companies were no greater than three times our size with regard to both measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee included these three companies despite their size because they compete directly with Lilly, have similar business models, and seek to hire from the same pool of management and scientific talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the aggregate, the companys total compensation to named executive officers, when reviewed at the end of 2015, was in the middle range of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of Our Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation has three components: (1) base salary; (2) annual cash bonus, which is calculated based on company's performance relative to internal targets for revenue, earnings per share (EPS), and the progress of the pipeline; and (3) two different forms of equity incentives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Performance Awards (PAs)equity awards vesting over three years, with a performance component measuring the company's two-year growth in EPS relative to the expected peer group growth followed by a 13-month service-vesting period; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Shareholder Value Awards (SVAs)performance- based equity awards that pay out based on absolute company stock price growth and total shareholder return (TSR) relative to peers, both measured over a three-year period, followed by a one-year holding period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives also receive a company benefits package, described below under "Other Compensation Practices and Information - Employee Benefits."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments to reported financial results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has authority to adjust the reported revenue and EPS on which incentive compensation payouts are determined in order to eliminate the distorting effect of unusual income or expense items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These items may impact year-over-year growth percentages or improve comparability with peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee considers the adjustments approved by the Audit Committee for reporting non-GAAP EPS and other adjustments, based on guidelines approved by the committee prior to the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further details on the adjustments for 2016 and the rationale for making these adjustments are set forth in Appendix A, "Summary of Adjustments Related to the Annual Cash Bonus and Performance Award."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For ease of reference, throughout the CD&A and the other compensation disclosures we refer simply to "revenue" and "EPS" but we encourage you to review the information in Appendix A to understand the adjustments from GAAP revenue and EPS that were approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are reviewed and established annually, and may also be adjusted upon promotion, following a change in job responsibilities, or to maintain market competitiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaries are based on each person's level of contribution, responsibility, and expertise, along with peer group data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual base salary increases are established based upon a corporate budget for salary increases, which is set considering company performance over the prior year, expected company performance for the following year, and general external trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting salaries, the Compensation Committee seeks to retain, motivate, and reward successful performers while maintaining affordability within the company's business plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Annual Cash Bonus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Eli Lilly and Company Bonus Plan (Bonus Plan) is designed to reward successful achievement of the company's financial plans and pipeline objectives for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus is based on company performance in three areas over the course of the year, relative to internal targets: (1) revenue; (2) EPS; and (3) pipeline progress.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company performance goals and individual bonus targets are set at the beginning of each year, and actual bonuses can range from 0 to 200 percent of an individual's bonus target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing performance goals, the Compensation Committee references the annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the committee reviews the relative weighting for each of the factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 weightings remained unchanged from the prior year:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goal Weighting Revenue performance 25% EPS performance 50% Pipeline progress 25%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this weighting, the company bonus multiple is calculated as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (0.25 x revenue multiple) + (0.50 x EPS multiple) + (0.25 x pipeline multiple) = company bonus multiple
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiples for each performance goal can range from 02.0.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual cash bonus payout is calculated as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: company bonus multiple x individual bonus target x base salary earnings = payout
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To preserve tax deductibility of bonus payouts, EOs are subject to the Executive Officer Incentive Plan (EOIP), which sets limits on allowable bonus amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the EOIP, the maximum annual cash bonus allowable is calculated based on non-GAAP net income (generally described in "Adjustments to Reported Results" in Appendix A to this proxy statement) for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the CEO, the maximum bonus award is 0.3 percent of non-GAAP net income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For other EOs, the maximum amount is 0.15 percent of non-GAAP net income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EOs will not receive any annual cash bonus payments unless the company has a positive non-GAAP net income for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the maximum payout for an EO is determined, the Compensation Committee has the discretion to reduce (but not increase) the amount of the annual cash bonus to be paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exercising this discretion, the committee intends to award EOs the lesser of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the bonuses they would have received under the Bonus Plan or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the EOIP maximum bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Equity Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company grants two types of equity incentives to EOsPAs and SVAs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PAs are designed to focus company eaders on multiyear operational performance relative to peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SVAs align earned compensation with long- term growth in shareholder value and relative performance within our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the discretion to adjust downward (but not upward) any EO's equity award payout from the amount yielded by the applicable formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PAs vest over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential shares are earned based on achieving EPS growth targets over a two-year performance period, followed by an additional 13-month service-vesting period in the form of restricted stock units ("RSUs").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The growth-rate targets are set relative to the median expected EPS growth for the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards do not accumulate dividends during the two-year performance period, but do accumulate dividends during the service- vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes EPS growth is an effective measure of operational performance because it is closely linked to shareholder value, is broadly communicated to the public, is easily understood by employees, and allows for objective comparisons to peer group performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our compensation objectives, company performance exceeding the expected peer group median will result in above-target payouts, while company performance lagging the expected peer group median will result in below-target payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Possible payouts range from 0 to 150 percent of the target depending on EPS growth over the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The measure of EPS used in the PA program differs from the measure used in our annual cash bonus program in two ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, the target EPS goal in the bonus program is set with reference to internal goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that align to our annual operating plan for the year, while the target EPS goal in the PA program is set relative to expected growth rates among our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, the bonus program measures EPS over a one-year period, while the PA program measurers EPS over a two-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a given year, as seen in prior years, the bonus program may pay out above target while the PA pays at threshold (or vice versa).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Value Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVAs are earned based on Lilly's share price (and beginning in 2016, relative TSR performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVAs have a three-year performance period, and any shares paid out are subject to a one-year holding requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividends are accrued during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVAs pay out above target if Lilly stock outperforms an expected compounded annual rate of return and below target if company stock underperforms that rate of return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expected rate of return includes dividends and is based on the three-year TSR that a reasonable investor would consider appropriate for investing in a basket of large-cap U.S. companies, as determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target share price is based on his expected rate of return less the companys dividend yield, applied to the starting share price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EOs receive no payout if Lilly's TSR for the three-year period is zero or negative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Possible payouts based on share price growth goals (prior to applying the applicable modifier described below) range from 0 to 150 percent of the target amount, depending on stock performance over the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with the 2016-2018 SVA award, a modifier based on Lilly's three-year cumulative TSR relative to our peer companies' median TSR performance will be applied to payouts for EOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Lilly's TSR is above the median of our peers, the payout is increased by 1 percent for every percentage point Lilly's TSR exceeds the median (up to a maximum of 20 percent).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, if Lilly's TSR is below our peers' median, the payout will be reduced by up to a maximum of 20 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee added the relative TSR modifier to the SVA program because it ensures senior leaders' rewards align with shareholder experience while encouraging strong performance within the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The mix of compensation for the CEO and other named executive officers (NEO) reflects our desire to link executive compensation with company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As reflected in the charts below, a substantial portion of the target pay for all named executive officers is performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the annual cash bonus and equity payouts are contingent upon company performance, with the bonus factoring in performance over a one-year period, and equity compensation factoring in performance over a longer term (as described above under "Components of Our Compensation - 3. Equity Incentives").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Target Total Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Review Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting potential EO compensation for 2016, the Compensation Committee considered both individual and company performance during 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015 Individual NEO Performance A summary of the committee's revie
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. John Lechleiter: In accordance with the companys Corporate Governance Guidelines, the independent directors conducted a review of Dr. Lechleiters performance during 2015, which was provided to the Compensation Committee during a private session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Dr. Lechleiters leadership, the company increased its growth prospects in the medium and long term and drove near-term volume growth, attributable to new products including Cyramza, Trulicity, and Jardiance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the company launched Basaglar and Portrazza, following the successful launch of three new molecular entities (NMEs) in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the company achieved the successful integration of Novartis Animal Health and led an initiative to improve the efficiency and sustainability of the companys research and development process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Lechleiter continued to set a positive tone of integrity, inclusiveness, safety, and compliance in his internal and external interactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derica Rice: Mr. Rice demonstrated strong leadership of our portfolio management in partnership with Dr. Lundberg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee noted the portfolio review process is far more robust than in past years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His function met very difficult financial targets while continuing to provide outstanding support to the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jan Lundberg: Dr. Lundberg led Lilly Research Laboratories positive pipeline progression, including regulatory approvals for Cyramza in 2nd-line gastric cancer in Japan and 2nd-line metastatic colorectal cancer in the U.S., Trulicity in Japan, Humalog U-200 Kwikpen, and Glyxambi in the U.S., and Synjardy in the U.S. and Europe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, regulatory submissions were completed for Taltz and all planned Phase 3 trial starts were achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Lundberg played a key leadership role in reorganizing external research.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He sponsored the expansion of our research capabilities in San Diego and Boston and progressed our next-generation development strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael Harrington: Mr. Harrington provided thoughtful counsel on a variety of issues including commercial practices, pricing, intellectual property policy, and several other areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was instrumental in several successful negotiations with external parties, and the company prevailed in several patent lawsuits including Alimta in the U.S. and Europe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enrique Conterno: Under Mr. Conterno's leadership, the Diabetes business had a very strong year beating revenue and earnings targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The business successfully launched several new products in the U.S. (Trulicity, Humalog U-200 Kwikpen, Glyxambi, and Synjardy).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Conterno drove improvements in manufacturing our insulin products and forged strong partnerships with other functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information in the section below reflects target total compensation for NEOs for 2016.

sentences.text: The actual payouts made to the named executive officers in the form of the 2016 annual cash bonus and equity awards granted in prior years and vesting in 2016 are summarized in the next section, under "2016 Compensation Payouts."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee established 2016 target total compensation opportunities for each NEO based on the NEO's 2015 performance, internal relativity, and peer-group data.

sentences.text: The committee determined that an increase to Dr. Lechleiters total compensation was appropriate given overall company results and his strong leadership over several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee decided his increase should be delivered entirely in performance-based equity, leaving his base salary and bonus target unchanged from prior years and increasing the target value of his equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Dr. Lundberg, the committee believed his base salary was appropriate but increased his bonus target and equity award reflecting the strategic importance and impact of the R&D organizations success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Conterno, Harrington, and Rice received salary increases, aligned with the company's annual increase guidelines, and increases to their bonus targets, reflecting their contributions over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the Diabetes business's strong performance, Mr. Conterno also received an increase in his equity award.

sentences.text: 2016 Company Performance - Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the company exceeded its revenue target with annual revenues of $21.2 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company fell short of its EPS target, with EPS of $3.52.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company also made significant progress on its pipeline, meeting or exceeding most targets for pipeline progress, highlighted by regulatory approval for Lartruvo and Taltz, along with 19 other new approvals, indications, or line extensions during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
