sentences.text: Other Compensation Practices and Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company offers core employee benefits coverage to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide our workforce with a reasonable level of financial support in the event of illness or injury;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: enhance productivity and job satisfaction through benefit programs that focus on overall well-being
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits available are the same for all U.S. employees and include medical and dental coverage, disability insurance, and life insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, The Lilly Employee 401(k) plan (401(k) Plan) and The Lilly Retirement Plan (the Retirement Plan) provide U.S. employees a reasonable level of retirement income reflecting employees careers with the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any employees retirement benefit exceeds Internal Revenue Service (IRS) limits for amounts that can be paid through a qualified plan, the company also offers a nonqualified pension plan and a nonqualified savings plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These plans provide only the difference between the calculated benefits and the IRS limits, and the formula is the same for all U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cost of employee benefits is partially borne by the employee, including each EO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company provides very limited perquisites to EOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does not generally allow personal use of the corporate aircraft; however the aircraft was made available for the personal use of Dr. Lechleiter, prior to his retirement, and for Mr. Ricks beginning in 2017, in very rare cases when the security and efficiency benefits to the company outweigh the expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company did not incur any expenses for personal use of its aircraft in 2016 by Dr. Lechleiter, and he received no other perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depending on seat availability,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: family members and personal guests of EOs may travel on the company aircraft to accompany EOs who are traveling on business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no incremental cost to the company for these trips.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lilly Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of senior management may defer receipt of part or all of their cash compensation under The Lilly Deferred Compensation Plan (Deferred Compensation Plan), which allows executives to save for retirement in a tax-effective way at minimal cost to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this unfunded plan, amounts deferred by the executive are credited at an interest ate of 120 percent of the applicable federal long-term rate, as described in more detail following the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation in 2016 table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in the case of a change in control of the company, the company is not obligated to pay severance to EOs upon termination of their employment; any such payments are at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has adopted change-in-control severance pay plans for nearly all employees, including the EOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plans are intended to preserve employee morale and productivity and encourage retention in the face of the disruptive impact of an actual or rumored change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the plans are intended to align executive and shareholder interests by enabling executives to evaluate corporate transactions that may be in the best interests of the shareholders and other constituents of the company without undue concern over whether the transactions may jeopardize the executives own employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of our change-in-control severance plans  all regular employees are covered  double trigger generally required  no tax gross-ups  up to two-year pay protection  18-month benefit continuation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although benefit levels may differ depending on the employees job level and seniority, the basic elements of the plans are comparable for all eligible employees:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double trigger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike single trigger plans that pay out immediately upon a change in control, our plans generally require a double triggera change in control followed by an involuntary loss of employment within two years thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is consistent with the plan's intent to provide employees with financial protection upon loss of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A partial exception is made for outstanding PAs, a portion of which would be paid out upon a change in control on a pro-rated basis for time worked based on the forecasted payout level at the time of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This partial payment is appropriate because it is not possible to convert the company EPS targets into an award based on the surviving companys EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, if Lilly is not the surviving entity, a portion of outstanding SVAs would be paid out on a pro-rated basis for time worked up to the change in control based on the merger price for company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Covered terminations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are eligible for payments if, within two years of the change in control, their employment is terminated
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) without cause by the company or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) for good reason by the employee, each as is defined in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Executive Compensation - Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control for a more detailed discussion, including a discussion of what constitutes a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who suffer a covered termination receive up to two years of pay and 18 months of benefits protection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These provisions assure employees a reasonable period of protection of their income and core employee benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible terminated employees would receive a severance payment ranging from six months to two years base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are all eligible for two years base salary plus two times the then-current years target bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerated vesting of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any unvested equity awards would vest at the time of a covered termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excise tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In some circumstances, the payments or other benefits received by the employee in connection with a change in control could exceed limits established under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employee would then be subject to an excise tax on top of normal federal income tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does not reimburse employees for these taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the amount of change in control-related benefits will be reduced to the 280G limit if the effect would be to deliver a greater after-tax benefit than the employee would receive with an unreduced benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership and Retention Guidelines; Prohibition on Hedging and Pledging Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share ownership and retention guidelines help to foster a focus on long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO is required to own company stock valued at least six times annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The holding requirement for other EOs ranges from two to three times annual base salary depending on the position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the required number of shares is reached, the EO must retain 50 percent of shares net of taxes received from new equity payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives have a long history of maintaining significant levels of company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Dr. Lechleiter held shares valued at approximately 59 times his annual salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ricks will retain at least 50 percent of net shares received from future equity payouts until he satisfies these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows the share requirements for each NEO:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Share Requirement Owns Required Shares Dr. Lechleiter six times base salary Yes Mr. Rice three times base salary Yes Dr. Lundberg three times base salary Yes Mr. Harrington three times base salary Yes Mr. Conterno three times base salary Yes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EOs are also required to hold all shares received from equity program payouts, net of acquisition costs and taxes, for at least one year, even once share ownership requirements have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For PAs, this holding requirement is met by the 13-month service-vesting period that applies after the end of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors and employees are not permitted to hedge their economic exposures to company stock through short sales or derivative transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors and all members of senior management are prohibited from pledging any company stock (i.e., using company stock as collateral for a loan or trading shares on margin).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Recovery Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All incentive awards are subject to forfeiture upon termination of employment prior to the end of the performance or vesting period or for disciplinary reasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee has adopted an executive compensation recovery policy, that gives the Compensation Committee broad discretion to claw back incentive payouts from any member of senior management (approximately 160 employees) whose misconduct results in a material violation of law or company policy that causes significant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: harm to the company or who fails in his or her supervisory responsibility to prevent such misconduct by others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the company can recover all or a portion of any EO incentive compensation in the case of materially inaccurate financial statements or material errors in the performance calculation, whether or not they result in a restatement and whether or not the EO has engaged in wrongful conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recovery policy covers any incentive compensation awarded or paid to an employee at a time when he or she is a member of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subsequent changes in status, including retirement or termination of employment, do not affect the companys rights to recover compensation under the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoveries under the plan can extend back as far as three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Looking Ahead to 2017 Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lilly's board of directors unanimously elected David A. Ricks to assume the role of president and chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He became president, chief executive officer, and a director on January 1, 2017, and will become chairman of the board on June 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with his appointment as president and chief executive officer, Mr. Ricks will receive a base salary of $1.4 million and will be eligible for an annual cash bonus with a target value of 150 percent of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ricks received an equity award in February 2017 as part of the company's annual equity incentive program with a grant value of $8.5 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One hundred percent of this grant value was delivered in the form of performance based equity: 60 percent in SVAs and 40 percent in PAs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He does not receive any compensation for his service as a director of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with 2017 grants, the treatment of performance-based equity awards (Performance Awards and Shareholder Value Awards) in the event of a change-in-control require a double trigger (a change-in-control occurs plus termination of employment) to pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accrued performance will be used to determine the number of shares earned under the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards will convert to restricted stock units that continue to vest with the new company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will payout upon the earlier of the completion of the original award period or upon a covered termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide retirement income to eligible U.S. employees, including EOs, through the following plans:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retirement Plan, a tax-qualified defined benefit plan that provides monthly benefits to retirees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Pension Benefits in 2016 table below for additional information about the value of these pension benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sections 401 and 415 of the Internal Revenue Code generally limit the amount of annual pension that can be paid from a tax-qualified plan ($265,000 in 2016 and $270,000 in 2017) as well as the amount of annual earnings that can be used to calculate a pension benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, since 1975 the company has maintained a nonqualified pension plan that pays retirees the difference between the amount payable under the Retirement Plan and the amount they would have received without the Internal Revenue Code limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nonqualified pension plan is unfunded and subject to forfeiture in the event of bankruptcy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise the company maintains a nonqualified savings plan that allows participants to contribute up to 6 percent of base salary exceeding the IRS limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company matches these contributions as described for the 401(k) Plan.

sentences.text: The Retirement Plan benefits shown in the table are net present values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits are not payable as a lump sum; they are generally paid as a monthly annuity for the life of the retiree and, if elected, any qualifying survivor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual benefit under the retirement plan is calculated using years of service and the average of the annual earnings (salary plus bonus) for the highest five out of the last 10 calendar years of service (final average earnings).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-2009 Plan Information: Following amendment of our Retirement Plan formulae, employees hired on or after February 1, 2008 have accrued retirement benefits only under the new plan formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired before that date have accrued benefits under both the old and new plan formulae.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All eligible employees, including those hired on or after February 1, 2008, can retire at age 65 with at least five years of service and receive an unreduced benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual benefit under the new plan formula is equal to 1.2 percent of final average earnings multiplied by years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early retirement benefits under this plan formula are reduced 6 percent for each year under age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transition benefits were afforded to employees with 50 points (age plus service) or more as of December 31, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits were intended to ease the transition to the new retirement formula for those employees who were closer to retirement or had been with the company longer at the time the plan was changed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the transition group, early retirement benefits are reduced 3 percent for each year from age 65 to age 60 and 6 percent for each year under age 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All named executive officers except Dr. Lundberg are in this transition group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-2010 Plan Information: Employees hired prior to February 1, 2008, accrued benefits under both plan formulae.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these employees, benefits that accrued before January 1, 2010, were calculated under the old plan formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the benefit is calculated using actual years of service through December 31, 2009, while total years of service is used to determine eligibility and early retirement reductions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit amount is increased (but not decreased) proportionately, based on final average earnings at termination compared to final average earnings at December 31, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full retirement benefits are earned by employees with 90 or more points (the sum of his or her age plus years of service).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees electing early retirement receive reduced benefits as described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit for employees with between 80 and 90 points is reduced by 3 percent for each year under 90 points or age 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit for employees who have less than 80 points, but who reached age 55 and have at least 10 years of service, is reduced as described above and is further reduced by 6 percent for each year under 80 points or age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Death and Disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A termination of employment due to death or disability does not entitle named executive officers to any payments or benefits that are not available to U.S. salaried employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination for Cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives terminated for cause receive no severance or enhanced benefits and forfeit any unvested equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change-in-Control Severance Pay Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the CD&A under Severance Benefits, the company maintains a change-in-control severance pay plan for nearly all employees, including the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change-in- control plan defines a change in control very specifically, but generally the terms include the occurrence of one of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) acquisition of 20 percent or more of the companys stock;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) replacement by the shareholders of one half or more of the Board of Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) consummation of a merger, share exchange, or consolidation of the company (other than a transaction that results in the Lilly shareholders prior to the transaction continuing to hold more than 60 percent of the voting stock of the combined entity); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) liquidation of the company or sale or disposition of all or substantially all of its assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts shown in the table for involuntary or good-reason termination after change in control are based on the following assumptions and plan provisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Covered terminations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table assumes a termination of employment that is eligible for severance under the terms of the plan, based on the named executive officers compensation, benefits, age, and service credit at December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible terminations include an involuntary termination for reasons other than for cause or a voluntary termination by the executive for good reason, within two years following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A termination of an EO by the company is for cause if it is for any of the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the employees willful and continued refusal to perform, without legal cause, his or her material duties, resulting in demonstrable economic harm to the company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any act of fraud, dishonesty, or gross misconduct resulting in significant economic harm or other significant harm to the business reputation of the company; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) conviction of or the entering of a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a felony.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A termination by the EO is for good reason if it results from:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a material diminution in the nature or status of the executives position, title, reporting relationship, duties, responsibilities, or authority, or the assignment to him or her of additional responsibilities that materially increase his or her workload;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any reduction in the executives then-current base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a material reduction in the executives opportunities to earn incentive bonuses below those in effect for the year prior to the change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a material reduction in the executives employee benefits from the benefit levels in effect immediately prior to the change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) the failure to grant to the executive stock options, stock units, performance shares, or similar incentive rights during each 12-month period following the change in control on the basis of a number of shares or units and all other material terms at least as favorable to the executive as those rights granted to him or her on an annualized average basis for the three-year period immediately prior to the change in control; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) relocation of the executive by more than 50 miles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash severance payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash severance payment amounts to two times the EO's annual base salary plus two times the EOs bonus target for that year under the bonus plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of medical and welfare benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount represents the present value of the change-in-control plans provision, following a covered termination, of 18 months of continued coverage equivalent to the companys current active employee medical, dental, life, and long-term disability insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar actuarial assumptions to those used to calculate incremental pension benefits apply to the calculation for continuation of medical and welfare benefits, with the addition of actual COBRA rates based on current benefit elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acceleration of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a covered termination, any unvested equity awards would vest and a partial payment of outstanding PAs would be made, reduced to reflect the portion of the performance period worked prior to the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, in the case of a change in control in which Lilly is not the surviving entity, SVAs would pay out based on the change-in-control stock price and be prorated for the portion of the three-year performance period elapsed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount in this column represents the value of the acceleration of unvested equity grants, prorated for PAs and SVAs that would have been applicable at December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excise taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control, employees may be subject to certain excise taxes under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does not reimburse the affected employees for those excise taxes or any income taxes payable by the employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To reduce the employee's exposure to excise taxes, the employees change- in-control benefit may be decreased to maximize the after-tax benefit to the individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments Upon Change in Control Alone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the change-in-control plan is a double trigger plan, meaning payments are made only if the employee suffers a covered termination of employment within two years following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are limited exceptions for pro-rata portions of PAs and SVAs, based on performance to the date of the change in control, as noted above under "Acceleration of equity awards."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Independent Consultant in assessing Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has retained Cimi B. Silverberg of Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc., as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Silverberg reports directly to the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither she nor her firm is permitted to have any business or personal relationship with management or the members of the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultants responsibilities are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review the companys total compensation philosophy, peer group, and target competitive positioning for reasonableness and appropriateness;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review the companys executive compensation program and advise the committee of evolving best p
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review draft CD&A and related tables for the proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: proactively advise the committee on best practices for board governance of executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: undertake special projects at the request of the committee chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Silverberg interacts directly with members of company management only on matters under the committees oversight and with the knowledge and permission of the committee chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of EOs and Management in assessing Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the oversight of the CEO and the senior vice president of human resources and diversity, the companys global compensation group formulates recommendations on compensation philosophy, plan design, and compensation for EOs (other than the CEO, as noted below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO provides the committee with a performance assessment and compensation recommendation for each of the other EOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee considers those recommendations with the assistance of its consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO and the senior vice president of human resources and diversity attend committee meetings; they are not present for executive sessions or any discussion of their own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only non-employee directors and the committees consultant attend executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO does not participate in the formulation or discussion of his pay recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has no prior knowledge of the recommendations that the consultant makes to the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Assessment Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a part of the company's overall enterprise risk management program, in 2016 the committee reviewed the companys compensation policies and practices and concluded that the programs and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee noted numerous policy and design features of the companys compensation programs and governance structure that reduce the likelihood of inappropriate risk-taking, including, but not limited to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee is comprised of independent directors only.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee engages its own independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has downward discretion to lower compensation plan payou
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee approves all adjustments to financial results that affect compensation calculations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Different measures and metrics are used across multiple incentive plans that appropriately balance cash/stock,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: fixed/variable pay, and short-term/long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive plans have predetermined maximum payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance objectives are challenging but achievable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Programs with operational metrics have a continuum of payout multiples based upon achievement of performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: milestones, rather than "cliffs" that might encourage sub-optimal or improper behavio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A compensation recovery policy is in place for all members of senior management; negative compensation consequences can be applied in cases of serious compliance violations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meaningful share ownership requirements are in place for all members of senior management and the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates and establishes compensation for EOs and oversees the deferred compensation plan, the companys management stock plans, and other management incentive and benefit programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has he primary responsibility for the companys financial statements and reporting process, including the disclosure of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this in mind, the Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed with management he CD&A above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the CD&A be included in this proxy statement for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Ralph Alvarez, Chair Ellen R. Marram Kathi P. Seifert
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with federal legislation enacted in 2010 requiring advisory shareholder votes on executive compensation, we are required this year to ask shareholders, on an advisory basis, whether they would prefer advisory named executive officer compensation votes every year, every two years, or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy or voting instruction card allows you to choose the frequency you prefer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders should consider the value of having the opportunity every year to voice their opinion on the companys named executive officer compensation through an advisory vote, weighing that against the additional burden and expense o the company and shareholders of preparing and responding to proposals annually, as well as the other means available o shareholders to provide input on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On balance, we support advisory votes on named executive officer compensation every year, and they are currently occurring annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We welcome shareholder input and believe that the value of an annual vote outweighs the burden of preparing annual proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe annual advisory votes on named executive officer compensation provide a meaningful way to continue dialogue with shareholders regarding this issue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board is not bound by this advisory shareholder vote; however, it will give significant weight to shareholder preferences on this matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Recommendation on Item 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR an ANNUAL advisory vote on the compensation of the company's named executive officers as disclosed in its proxy statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the Appointment of Principal Independent Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Oversight of Independent Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention, and oversight of the independent auditor, and oversees the process for selecting, reviewing, and evaluating the lead audit partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further information regarding the committee's oversight of the independent auditor can be found in the Audit Committee charter, available online at https://www.lilly.com/who-we-are/governance, or upon request to the company's corporate secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the decision regarding whether to reappoint the independent auditor each year (subject to shareholder ratification), the committee assesses the independent auditor's performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment examines three primary criteria: (1) the independent auditor's qualifications and experience; (2) the communication and interactions with the auditor over the course of the year; and (3) the auditor's independence, objectivity, and professional skepticism.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These criteria are assessed against an internal and an external scorecard, and are discussed with management during a private session, as well as in executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee also periodically considers whether a rotation of the company's ndependent auditor is advisable.

sentences.text: Based on this year's assessment of EY's performance, the Audit Committee believes that the continued retention of EY to serve as the company's principal independent auditor is in the best interests of the company and its shareholders, and has therefore reappointed the firm of EY as principal independent auditor for the company for 2017.

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews the companys financial reporting process on behalf of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the financial statements and the reporting process, including the systems of internal controls and disclosure controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this context, the committee has met and held discussions with management and the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management represented to the committee that the companys consolidated financial statements were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), and the committee has reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements and related disclosures with management and the independent auditor, including a review of he significant management judgments underlying the financial statements and disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditor reports to the Audit Committee, which has sole authority to appoint and to replace the independent auditor (subject to shareholder ratification).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has discussed with the independent auditor matters required to be discussed with the Audit Committee by the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) and the NYSE, including the quality, not just the acceptability, of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments, and the clarity of the disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from the independent auditor required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and has discussed with the independent auditor the auditors independence from the company and its management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In concluding that the auditor is independent, the committee determined, among other things, that the nonaudit services provided by EY (as described below) were compatible with its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the requirements of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (the Sarbanes-Oxley Act), the committee has adopted policies to ensure the independence of the independent auditor, such as prior committee approval of nonaudit services and required audit partner rotation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee discussed with the companys internal and independent auditors the overall scope and plans for their respective audits, including internal control testing under Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee periodically meets with the internal and independent auditors, with and without management present, and in private sessions with members of senior management (such as the chief financial officer and the chief accounting officer) to discuss the results of their examinations, their evaluations of the companys internal controls, and the overall quality of the companys financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee also periodically meets in executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reliance on the reviews and discussions referred to above, the committee recommended to the Board (and the Board subsequently approved the recommendation) that the audited financial statements be included in the companys annual report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has also appointed the companys independent auditor, subject to shareholder ratification, for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-related services: Audit-related services are assurance and related services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or reviews of the financial statements, and that are traditionally performed by the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes that the provision of these services does not impair the independence of the auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax services: The committee believes that, in appropriate cases, the independent auditor can provide tax compliance services, tax planning, and tax advice without impairing the auditors independence.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the services are permissible under SEC and PCAOB rules,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the committee believes the provision of the services would not impair the independence of the auditor, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) management believes that the auditor is the best choice to provide the services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval process: At the beginning of each audit year, management requests prior committee approval of the annua audit, statutory audits, and quarterly reviews for the upcoming audit year as well as any other services known at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management will also present at that time an estimate of all fees for the upcoming audit year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As specific engagements are identified thereafter, they are brought forward to the committee for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent approvals are required between regularly scheduled committee meetings, preapproval authority is delegated to the committee chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each engagement, management provides the committee with information about the services and fees, sufficiently detailed to allow the committee to make an informed judgment about the nature and scope of the services and the potential for the services to impair the independence of the auditor.

sentences.text: Directors' Deferral Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal to Amend the Lilly Directors' Deferral Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lilly Directors Deferral Plan provides an ownership position in the company that aligns directors with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan was last approved by shareholders in 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the plan, a portion of directors' annual compensation is awarded in deferred shares:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all shares must be held until the second January following the director's departure from board service  no stock options can be issued under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes to the plan include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: authorizing an additional 750,000 shares (the same amount approved in 2003)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a cap on non-employee directors compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We summarize the principal features of the plan below, subject to the full text of the plan, which is attached to this proxy statement as Appendix B.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible Participants   The plan is available only to non-salaried directors, as further defined in the plan document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are currently 17 eligible directors, 13 active and 4 retired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Administration   The plan is administered by the directors and corporate governance committee of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Authorized   A total of 1,500,000 shares of Lilly stock may be issued or transferred under the restated plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the period April 29, 2003, through December 31, 2016, the aggregate number of authorized shares was 750,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 17, 2017, 300,685 shares have been paid out under the plan and 457,071 shares were credited to participants accounts (including retired directors), and those shares would be counted against the share limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent Stock Price   The closing price of Lilly stock on the New York Stock Exchange on February 17, 2017, was $80.39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elective Deferrals   Prior to the beginning of each year, a director may irrevocably elect to defer all or a portion of his or her retainer and meeting fees for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director can choose to have the funds credited to either of two accounts:  Deferred Compensation Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Funds are credited monthly and earn interest equal to 120 percent of the applicable long-term federal rate with monthly compounding, as posted by the Internal Revenue Service annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interest rate is adjusted each December.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments from this account are made in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Stock Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This account allows the director, in effect, to invest cash compensation in Lilly stock, with receipt deferred until the second January following the end of board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred funds are credited monthly, and the annual share award described below is credited annually, as hypothetical shares of Lilly stock, based on the market price of the stock on a monthly valuation date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hypothetical dividends are reinvested in additional share units based on the market price of the stock on the date that common stock dividends are paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments from this account are made in shares of Lilly stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No shares are issued or transferred until the second January following the director's departure from board service or the director dies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Limits   Each eligible director receives an annual credit to his or her deferred stock account of the number of hypothetical shares of Lilly stock equal to $160,000 on a valuation date specified in the plan (or such other number as the board may establish by resolution).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual share award may not exceed the lesser of 7,500 shares or an amount equal to $800,000 minus the directors total cash compensation (including compensation deferred into the plan) for the relevant plan year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each independent director was credited with 2,088 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of stock compensation is prorated for months of service and may not be adjusted by the board more than once every calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment Options   At the time of the election to defer, the director chooses one of two payment options:  lump sum on the second January following the director's departure from board service  from two to ten annual installments beginning on the second January following the director's departure from board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan includes alternate payment provisions that call for accelerated payment in the case of death of the participant or an unexpected emergency causing a severe financial hardship that cannot be relieved through other available funds (as determined by the committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments for Capital Changes   In the event of stock split, stock dividend, spinoff or other relevant change affecting Lilly stock, the committee will adjust existing account balances in the deferred stock account and will also adjust the total number of shares available under the plan and the maximum annual award amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination and Amendment of Plan   The plan remains effective until terminated by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board may amend or terminate the plan in its discretion, subject to certain limitations, including that shareholder approval is required for any material amendments to the extent required by applicable NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Information   The amount of future benefits to be paid under the plan cannot be determined at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal: Report Regarding Direct and Indirect Political Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Comptroller of the State of New York, Thomas P. DiNapoli, trustee of the New York State Common Retirement Fund and the administrative head of the New York State and Local Retirement System, beneficial owner of 2,954,390 shares, has submitted the following proposal:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whereas, we believe in full disclosure of Eli Lilly's direct and indirect lobbying activities and expenditures to assess whether Eli Lilly's lobbying is consistent with Eli Lilly's expressed goals and in the best interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, the shareholders of Eli Lilly and Company ("Eli Lilly") request the preparation of a report, updated annually, disclosing:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments by Eli Lilly used for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) direct or indirect lobbying or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) grassroots lobbying communications, in each case including the amount of the payment and the recipient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Eli Lillys membership in and payments to any tax-exempt organization that writes and endorses model legislation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Description of the decision making process and oversight by management and the Board for making payments described in section 2 and 3 above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this proposal, a "grassroots lobbying communication" is a communication directed to the genera public that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) refers to specific legislation or regulation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) reflects a view on the legislation or regulation and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) encourages the recipient of the communication to take action with respect to the legislation or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Indirect obbying" is lobbying engaged in by a trade association or other organization of which Ely Lilly is a member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both "direct and indirect lobbying and "grassroots lobbying communications" include efforts at the local, state and federal levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The report shall be presented to the Audit Committee or other relevant oversight committees and posted on Eli Lilly's website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement We encourage transparency in the use of corporate funds to influence legislation and regulation, both directly and indirectly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eli Lilly spent over $15.3 million in 2014 and 2015 on federal lobbying (opensecrets.org).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This figure does not include lobbying expenditures to influence legislation in states, where Eli Lilly also lobbies in 48 states ("Amid Federal Gridlock, Lobbying Rises in the States," Center for Public Integrity, February 11, 2016), but disclosure is uneven or absent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eli Lilly belongs to the Chamber of Commerce, which has spent over $1.2 billion on lobbying since 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eli Lilly does not disclose its payments to trade associations, or the amounts used for lobbying.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transparent reporting would reveal whether company assets are being used for objectives contrary to Eli Lillys long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Lilly supports smoking cessation, yet the Chamber works to block global smoking laws (U.S. Chamber Works Globally to Fight Antismoking Measures, New York Times, June 30, 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And Eli Lilly recognizes the risks posed by climate change, yet the Chamber has sued the EPA to block the Clean Power Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And Eli Lilly does not disclose its contributions to tax-exempt organizations that write and endorse model legislation, such as its serving on the Health and Human Services Task Force of the American Legislative Exchange Council (ALEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ALEC promotes legislation against state regulations addressing climate change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 100 companies have publicly left ALEC, including Allergan, Amgen, AstraZeneca, GlaxoSmithKline, Johnson & Johnson, Medtronic and Merk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Statement in opposition to the Shareholder Proposal Regarding Report on the Companys Direct and Indirect Political Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The public policy and compliance committee of the board has reviewed this proposal and recommends a vote against it, as we currently publish most of the information requested by the shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The additional reporting requirements are unnecessary, as the information requested is publicly available and this reporting would place an undue administrative burden on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2005, the company has published the following information on our website (www.lilly.com) for both direct company contributions and employee political action committee (PAC) contributions to support candidates for political office, political parties, officials, or committees in the United States:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: policies and procedures for company and PAC contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributions to political organizations and Section 527 organizations reported by state.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information is updated annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the information available on our website, detailed corporate contributions, PAC contribution data, and the companys direct lobbying expenses are available to the public on the Federal Election Committee website (http://www.fec.gov/disclosure.shtml) and through individual state agencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to direct political contributions, Lilly maintains memberships in certain trade associations that report lobbying activity to the U.S. government.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain memberships in trade associations and other tax-exempt organizations specific to business and pharmaceutical industry interests, such as PhRMA (Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers Association), BIO (Biotechnology Association), Healthcare Leadership Conference, and the National Association of Manufacturers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We support organizations that champion public policies that contribute to pharmaceutical innovation, healthy patients, and a healthy business climate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lilly Report of Political Financial Support notes our memberships in trade associations that report lobbying activity to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the U.S. government and to which we contribute $50,000 per year or more.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Organizations where Lilly has a board seat are also noted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tax exempt organizations are also required to disclose their lobbying expenditures under the Lobbying Act of 1995: they report their lobbying expenditures to the United States Senate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we do not control the portion of the organizations budget spent on lobbying, it is the fact of company membership and support for the trade association, and the trade associations total lobbying expenditure, that reveals the most about Lilly's political activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may instruct the plan trustee on how to vote your shares in the 401(k) plan via the Internet, by mail, or by telephone as described above, except that, if you vote by mail, the card that you use will be a voting instruction form rather than a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, unless you decline, your vote will apply to a proportionate number of other shares held by participants in the 401(k) plan for which voting directions are not received (except for a small number of shares from a prior stock ownership plan, which can be voted only on the directions of the participants to whose accounts the shares are credited).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All participants are named fiduciaries under the terms of the 401(k) plan and under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA) for the limited purpose of voting shares credited to their accounts and the portion of undirected shares to which their vote applies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under ERISA, fiduciaries are required to act prudently in making voting decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not want to have your vote applied to the undirected shares, you must so indicate when you vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise, the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: trustee will automatically apply your voting preferences to the undirected shares proportionally with
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all other participants who elected to have their votes applied in this manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not vote, your shares will be voted by other plan participants who have elected to have their voting preferences applied proportionally to all shares for which voting instructions are not otherwise received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy cards and notices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received more than one proxy card, notice, or e-mail related to proxy materials, you hold shares in more than one account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure that all your shares are voted, sign and return each card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, if you vote by telephone or on the Internet, you will need to vote once for each proxy card, notice, or e-mail you receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not receive a proxy card, you may have elected to receive your proxy statement electronically, in which case you should have received an e- mail with directions on how to access the proxy statement and how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to request a paper copy of these materials and a proxy card, please call 855-731-6026 (toll free) or 317-433-5112.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote tabulation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes are tabulated by an independent inspector of election, IVS Associates, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attending the annual meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the meeting will be limited to shareholders of record, those holding proxies from shareholders of record, and invited guests from the media and financial community.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders of record as of the record date may attend by presenting the admission ticket that appears at the end of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please fill it out and bring it with you to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be held at the Lilly Center Auditorium.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please use the Lilly Center entrance to the south of the fountain at the intersection of Delaware and McCarty streets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will need to pass through security, including a metal detector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Present your ticket to an usher at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Parking will be available on a first-come, first-served basis in the garage indicated on the map at the end of this report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have questions about admittance or parking, you may call 855-731-6026 (toll free) or 317-433-5112 (prior to the annual meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2018 annual meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys 2018 annual meeting is currently scheduled for May 7, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a procedure approved by the SEC called "householding."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the householding procedure, certain shareholders, whether they own registered shares or shares in street name, who have the same address will receive only one set of proxy materials, unless one or more of the shareholders at that address has previously notified us that they want to receive separate copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each 401(k) Plan participant will continue to receive a copy of all of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of how you own your shares, if you received a single set of proxy materials as a result of householding, and one or more shareholders at your address would like to have separate copies of these materials with respect to the 2017 annual meeting or in the future, please contact Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. at 1-866-540-7095.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other information regarding the companys proxy solicitation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors is soliciting proxies for the 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay all expenses in connection with our solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay brokers, nominees, fiduciaries, or other custodians their reasonable expenses for sending proxy material to and obtaining instructions from persons for whom they hold stock of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect to solicit proxies primarily by mail and email, but directors, officers, and other employees of the company may also solicit in person or by telephone, fax, or email.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have retained Georgeson LLC to assist in the distribution and solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Georgeson may solicit proxies by personal interview, telephone, fax, mail, and email.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that the fee for those services will not exceed $17,500 plus reimbursement of customary out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) beneficial ownership reporting compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SEC rules, our directors and EOs are required to file with the SEC reports of holdings and changes in beneficial ownership of company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have reviewed copies of reports provided to the company, as well as other records and information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on that review, we concluded that all reports were timely filed, except that, due to administrative errors, Jackson Tai was late in reporting two stock purchases and Fionnuala Walsh was late in reporting a stock sale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each filing was made promptly after the issue was discovered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A - Summary of Adjustments Related to the Annual Cash Bonus and Performance Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with past practice, the Compensation Committee adjusted the reported financial results on which the 2016 annual cash bonus and the 2015-2017 Performance Awards were determined to eliminate the distorting effect of certain unusual items on incentive compensation performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjustments are intended to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: avoid volatile, artificial inflation or deflation of awards due to unusual items in the award year, and, where relevant, the previous (comparator) year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: eliminate certain counterproductive short-term incentivesfor example, incentives to refrain from acquiring new technologies, to defer disposing of underutilized assets, or to defer settling legacy legal proceedings to protect current bonus payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: facilitate comparisons with peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assure the integrity of the adjustments, the Compensation Committee establishes adjustment guidelines in the first 90 days of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guidelines are generally consistent with the company guidelines for reporting non- GAAP financial measure to the investment community, which are reviewed by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjustments apply equally to income and expense items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews all adjustments and retains downward discretion, i.e., discretion to reduce compensation below the amounts that are yielded by the adjustment guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments for 2016 Bonus Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 bonus calculations, the Compensation Committee made the following adjustments to reported EPS consistent with our external reporting of non-GAAP financial measures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated the impact of the charge related to the Venezuelan financial crisis, including the significant deterioration of the bolivar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated the impact of the charge recognized for acquired in-process research and development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated the impact of asset impairments, restructuring and othe  Eliminated the impact of amortization of certain intangible assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reconciliations of these adjustments to our reported EPS are below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 EPS as reported $2.58 Eliminate impact of the Venezuelan financial crisis $0.19 Eliminate acquired in process research and development charge $0.02 Eliminate asset impairments, restructuring and other special charges $0.29 Eliminate amortization of certain intangible assets $0.44 Non-GAAP EPS $3.52
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments for 2015-2017 PA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015-2017 PA payout calculations, the Compensation Committee made the following adjustments to reported EPS consistent with our reporting of non-GAAP financial measures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016: Eliminated the impact of the Venezuelan financial crisis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016, 2015 and 2014: Eliminated the impact of the charges recognized for acquired in-process research and development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016, 2015 and 2014: Eliminated the impact of asset impairments, restructuring, and other special charges
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015: Eliminated the impact of the debt extinguishment loss.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015: Eliminated the impact of inventory step-up for Novartis Animal Health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014: Eliminated the impact of the charge for an extra year of the U.S. Branded Prescription Drug Fee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014: Eliminated the impact of gain related to transfer of our linagliptin and empagliflozin commercial rights in certain countries to Boehringer Ingelheim.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the adjustments consistent with our reporting of non-GAAP financial measures, the Compensation Committee made the following other adjustments:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Compensation Committee set 2015-2017 PA targets, the transfer of the commercialization rights for Erbitux in North America to Lilly (which occurred in October 2015) was not contemplated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the committee adjusted the 2016 and 2015 results to neutralize the expected EPS impact of the transfer of commercialization rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Compensation Committee set 2015-2017 PA targets, the EPS goals were set assuming the acquisition of Novartis Animal Health (which occurred in January 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the committee adjusted the base year 2014 results to include the results of Novartis Animal Health as if the acquisition and financing had occurred as of January 1, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Compensation Committee set 2015-2017 PA targets, the company began excluding amortization of certain intangible assets from non-GAAP financial measures in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To make effective comparisons, the committee adjusted the 2014 non-GAAP results to exclude the impact of amortization of certain intangible assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reconciliations of these adjustments to our reported EPS are below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 2015 % Growth 2016 vs. 2015 2014 % Growth 2015 vs. 2014 EPS as reported $2.58 $2.26 14.2% $2.23 1.3% Eliminate impact of the Venezuelan financial crisis $0.19       Eliminate acquired in process research and development charges $0.02 $0.33   $0.12   Eliminate asset impairments, restructuring and other special charges $0.29 $0.25   $0.38   Eliminate amortization of certain intangible assets $0.44 $0.39      Eliminate debt extinguishment loss  $0.09      Eliminate inventory step-up for Novartis Animal Health  $0.10      Eliminate additional U.S. Drug Fee     $0.11   Eliminate gain related to transfer of commercial rights to Boehringer Ingelheim     $(0.06)   Non-GAAP EPS $3.52 $3.43 2.6% $2.78 23.4% Transfer of Erbitux commercialization rights adjustment $(0.14) $(0.01)      Novartis Animal Health acquisition adjustment     $(0.07)   Amortization of certain intangible assets     $0.32   Adjusted Non-GAAP EPS $3.38 $3.42 (1.2)% $3.03 12.9% *Numbers may not add due to rounding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix B - The Lilly Directors' Deferral Plan (As Amended and Restated Effective January 1, 2017)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELI LILLY AND COMPANY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE LILLY DIRECTORS' DEFERRAL PLAN (as Amended and Restated on October 19, 2009 Effective January 1, 2017)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preamble
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lilly Directors Deferral Plan has been established by the Company for the purpose of providing an opportunity for Directors of the Company who are not salaried employees of the Company to voluntarily defer receipt of some or all of their meeting fees and retainer and to share in the long-term growth of the Company by acquiring, on a deferred basis, an ownership interest in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment as provided in Section 5(f), and contingent upon receiving approval of the Companys shareholders, effective January 1, 2017, the aggregate number of shares of Eli Lilly and Company common stock that may be issued or transferred under this Plan after is 1,500,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the period beginning April 28 29, 2003, is and ending December 31, 2016, the aggregate number of authorized shares was 750,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares Shares issued under the Plan may be authorized and unissued shares or treasury shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan constitutes a plan of unfunded deferred compensation and is intended to comply with the requirements of Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan, this Plan shall be interpreted, operated and administered in a manner consistent with these intentions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the rules that apply to the distribution of amounts that were earned and vested (within the meaning of Section 409A) under the Plan prior to 2005 (and earnings thereon) and are exempt from the requirements of Section 409A, see Appendix A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amendment and restatement of the Plan is effective January 1, 2017, contingent upon approval of the Companys shareholders at the Companys 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 1.Definition of Terms
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following terms used in the Plan shall have the meanings set forth below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Account means one or more deferred compensation accounts maintained for each Participant under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Participants Account shall consist of a Deferred Compensation Account and the Deferred Stock Account as described in Section 5 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    Annual Allocation Date means the last Business Day in November of each calendar year, or such other annual date, not earlier than the third Monday in February, established by the Plan Administrator as the date as of which the annual allocation of Shares are allocated described in Section 5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) is credited to each the Deferred Stock Account in accordance with Section 5, which shall be as soon as administratively feasible after the Annual Valuation Date but in no event later than the last Business Day in November of the applicable Plan Year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    Annual Valuation Date means the Valuation Date in November of each Plan Year, on which the annual allocation of Shares referenced in Section 5(c) is valued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)    Beneficiary means the person or persons who are designated by the Participant or are otherwise entitled to receive benefits under the Plan in the event of the Participants death, as provided in Section 6(d) hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e)    Board means the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f)     Business Day means a day on which the Companys corporate headquarters are open for regular
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g)     Code means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: h)     Company means Eli Lilly and Company, an Indiana corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i)     Deferral Amount means the amount of a Participants Monthly Compensation that is elected by a Participant for deferral under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j)    Deferred Compensation Account means the bookkeeping account described in Section 5(a)(i).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A sub-account shall be established within the Deferred Compensation Account for each Plan Year in which a Deferred Stock Participant elects to defer compensation into the Deferred Compensation Account in accordance with Section 4(a).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k)    Deferred Stock Account means the bookkeeping account described in Section 5(a)(ii).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A sub- account shall be established within the Deferred Stock Account for each Plan Year in which a Deferred Stock Participant elects to defer compensation into the Deferred Stock Account in accordance with Section 4(a) or receives allocations of Shares under Section 5, to hold the Shares allocated during such Plan Year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l)    Deferred Stock Participant means a Director who is not, and for the preceding 12 months has not been, a salaried employee of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m)    Director means a member of the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n)     Dividend Payment Date means the date as of which the Company pays a cash dividend o
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o)    Dividend Record Date means the date established by the Board of Directors as the record date for determining shareholders entitled to the dividend with respect to any Dividend Payment Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p)    Election Form means the written or electronic form or forms approved by the Plan Administrator and completed by the Participant specifying the Participants election to defer Monthly Compensation pursuant to Section 4 and setting forth the Participants Beneficiary designation and the terms of distribution of the Participants Deferred Compensation Account and/or Deferred Stock Account pursuant to Section 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q)     Monthly Compensation means the monthly retainer and the aggregate of all other fees and retainers, including, but not limited to, meeting fees, committee fees and committee chairperson fees to which a Director is entitled for services rendered to the Company as a Director during the month, as established from time to time by resolution of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
